original: Lundvall, Carl Hilding, skeppsmäklare, Göteborg, f. 26/9/88 i Hälsingb. av Carl L. o. Hilda Almquist. G. 19 m. Miargot Roseli. Barn: Marianne f. 20, g. m. leg. läk. Stig Johnson, Sthlm, Inga-lill 28. — Elev v. Hälsingb. h. a. 1. Res. f. uthprakt. h. Rotbt. Kleyens-büber & Co. i Königsberg 07-11, 13-16, h. D. M. Stevenson & Co i Nev^castle o. Grönquist, B ryan & Co. där 11-12. Anst. h. Svenska Lloyd 16-30, h. Aug. Leff.ler & Son 20-30, dir. o. skeppsmäkl. i A-B Carl Lundvall i Gbg fr. 30. Sekr. i Särö .lawntennis-kl. 20-28, medl. av skidfrämj., bild. G’bgs slalomkl., ordf. där. Hobbies: skidlöpn., tennis. Skidfrämj. SM, Fjäll-le darm.
translated: Lundvall, Carl Hilding, ship broker, Gothenburg, born on September 26, 1888 in Hälsingborg, son of Carl L. and Hilda Almquist. Married in 19xx to Margot Roseli. Children: Marianne, born in 1920, married to Dr. Stig Johnson in Stockholm; Inga-lill, born in 1928. Completed studies at Hälsingborg high school. Worked as an apprentice at Rotbt. Kleyens-büber & Co. in Königsberg from 1907-1911, 1913-1916, and at D.M. Stevenson & Co. in Newcastle and Grönquist, Bryan & Co. there in 1911-1912. Employed at Svenska Lloyd from 1916-1930, and at Aug. Leff.ler & Son from 1920-1930. Director and ship broker at A-B Carl Lundvall in Gothenburg from 1930 onwards. Secretary at Särö Lawntennis Club from 1920-1928, member of ski promotion committee, founder of Gothenburg slalom club, and chairman there. Hobbies: skiing and tennis. Participated in Swedish Skiing Championships, and Fjäll-le darm.

structured.name: Carl Hilding Lundvall
structured.description: Ship broker and secretary, known for being the founder and chairman of Gothenburg Slalom Club and his affiliation with Särö Lawntennis Club and the Ski Promotion Committee.
